title: q-Electroweak (II)
abstract: A gauged $SU_q(2)$ theory is characterized by two dual algebras, the first lying close to the Lie algebra of SU(2) while the second introduces new degrees of freedom that may be associated with non-locality or solitonic structure. The first and second algebras, here called the external and internal algebras respectively, define two sets of fields, also called external and internal. The gauged external fields agree with the Weinberg-Salam model at the level of the doublet representation but differ at the level of the adjoint representation. For example the g-factor of the charged W-boson differs in the two models. The gauged internal fields remain speculative but are analogous to color fields.
